subject: Re: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page
msgSnippet: Bloody hell, Nicholas     :-)) Just give the name of the book, will you !  :-)) You don t have to post the reply on the ML unless too many request it ! But you
messageBody:
Bloody hell, Nicholas     :-))
Just give the name of the book, will you !  :-))
 
You don't have to post the reply on the ML unless too many request it !
But you could have send some infos to me directly.
 
 
Nothing personnal, heee !
I just find it funny that you don't mention
the books title or whatever while request to :-))
 
 
Thomas,
 
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Nicholas Lesiecki
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, December 20, 2001 5:44 PM
Subject: RE: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page

It's actually been released, I just go my copies yesterday.
-----Original Message-----
From: Thomas SMETS [mailto:tsmets@...]
Sent: Thursday, December 20, 2001 8:53 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page

When is the book dued ?
In what phase is it @ the moment ?
Thomas,
----- Original Message -----
From: Nicholas Lesiecki
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, December 19, 2001 7:42 PM
Subject: RE: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page

Thanks Mike. BTW, good job on JUnitPerf, we've used it a couple of times. It
makes good use of the JUnit framework as well as being very practical. We
covered it in the book. I think Rick wrote the section.

Cheers,

Nick

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 19, 2001 11:03 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page

> I know the JUnit homepage lists article and links of interest to users of

a
> potential link to.
>

junit@....

Mike
